text:
hi,

 it'd be very useful for us if the property task could take an optional /url/ 
attribute just like it takes a /file/ attribute at the moment. Its a very 
simple change since you can use java.net.URL.openStream() and pass this to a 
Properties object.

thanks,
Andrew
creator: andrew.ferguson@arm.com
devgu@yahoo.com
text:
Created attachment 6806
A patch to add the url attribute to the property task (+doc)

creator: devgu@yahoo.com
text:
The attachment adds the url attribute support to the
<property> task and adds documentation to property.html.
The only thing i didn't add is a testcase.
I can't commit to the cvs so it's waiting for
a commiter to add it.
-Gu-

...but what about: proxy settings, password protection, handling failure, etc, etc?

I suppose <setproxy> handles the proxy details, but I still worry, especially
given <get> can be made to do the fetching today. 

On the other hand, the whole notion of a virtual file system is kind of
appealing -a web site is just a remote filestore supporting HTTP read and DAV write.
